message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.SE 

The paper discusses the issue of defending against DDoS attacks on web servers, which is a topic related to computer security (cs.CR) and network infrastructure (cs.NI). The proposed mechanism involves monitoring network traffic and using statistical analysis and hypothesis testing to detect abnormal traffic patterns, which falls under the category of distributed computing (cs.DC) and system and information theory (cs.SI). The paper also mentions the drawbacks of existing defense mechanisms and proposes a new mechanism, which is related to software engineering (cs.SE).
